arm_group.description: 16 obese female subjects with BMI > 40 kg/m2 on a waiting list for bariatric surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is aimed at assessing how Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGP) impacts on energy and
      nutrients' intake, energy expenditure, and nutritional status in obese patients. It will try
      quantitate energy and protein balance after RYGP, and to identify how RYGP effects the
      intake of various common dietary protein sources 16 female patients with BMI > 40 kg/m2 and
      on a waiting list for bariatric surgery will be included. The following measurements will be
      performed before, and 1, 3, 6, 12, and 36 months after RYGP

        -  body weight

        -  body composition (bio impedancemetry)

        -  basal metabolic rate (open circuit indirect calorimetry)

        -  24-hour urinary urea excretion

        -  fasting blood chemistry

        -  energy and macronutrient's intake (3-day dietary recall)

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Nutritional Status After Gastric Bypass Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age 18-65 years

          -  gender: females

          -  body mass index >35 kg/m2

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  GI tract diseases

          -  endocrine diseases

study_pop.textblock: 16 female obese subjects on a waiting list for gastric bypass bariatric surgery

clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Nutritional Status and Vitamin Deficiencies in Obese Subjects After Gastric Bypass Surgery

other_outcome.description: measurement will be obtained by indirect calorimetry
other_outcome.measure: changes in fasting, resting respiratory exchange ratio
other_outcome.time_frame: measurements obtained baseline, and 3, 6, 12, and 36 months after RYGP
Measurements obtained baseline , and 3, 6, 12, 36 months after RYGP

primary_outcome.description: changes in 24-hour protein intake will be evaluated by 7-day food diary; portion size will be assessed with the use of photographs from the SU.VI.MAX study
primary_outcome.measure: changes in daily dietary protein intake
primary_outcome.time_frame: measurements obtained baseline , and 1,3, 6, 12, 36 months after surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

secondary_outcome.time_frame: measurements obtained baseline , and 1,3, 6, 12, 36 months after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: BMR will be measured by indirect calorimetry over a 45-90 min period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measurements obtained baseline , and 3, 6, 12, 36 months after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Changes in daily total energy intake will be evaluated by 7-day food diary; portion size will be assessed with the use of photographs from the SU.VI.MAX study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measurements obtained baseline , and 1,3, 6, 12, 36 months after surgery

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
